turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: He's not like other guys.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: He's decent.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: He's kind.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I'd rather sing than do anything!

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: It's better than ice cream.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: It's better than springtime.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: But, Reverend Mother -- everyone loves our new style.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: It's brought people back to the church.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Ice cream!

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Mary Clarence -- you shouldn't have. Where did you get this?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Clarence, don't be silly.  You're an example to us all.  You've taught us so much.  We're singing for the Cardinals, and then -- who knows?  Maybe the choir can travel -- to schools, and nursing homes.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Maybe we can get some of the local kids to sing with us.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Mary Clarence!  Sister!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: It's no use.  She just isn't here.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: We can't sing without her!  What should we do?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: We'll pray -- and she'll be there.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: You mean -- they kidnapped her?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Yes -- two men -- and they had guns.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: An... entertainer?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: She wasn't a nun?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Well, I don't care who she is.  We can't sing without her!

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: She's our inspiration!

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: It's so beautiful...

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: And what a lovely name.  Las Vegas...

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: The Little Sisters of the Moonlight!

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: But how do we get there?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Excuse me -- has anyone seen a nun?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: A Benedictine.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Clarence -- you're alive!

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Christy.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Not a note.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Impossible.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: I don't understand.  Where is she?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Her whereabouts are unknown, and we must proceed without her.  Pull yourselves together.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Calm down.  Think clearly.  Mary Robert, do you have any idea who those men were?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: She said they were from her old convent.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: But... she was a showgirl.  She didn't have an old convent.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Las Vegas -- she's here somewhere.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: But where?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Reverend Mother?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Since Mary Clarence came to St. Katherine's, I've been shot at, kidnapped by Mafia hit men, and I've tasted beer. Is that enough experience yet?  For final vows?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Absolutely not.  I am very sorry, but no.

turns.speaker: O'HARA
turns.text: We can save this young woman's life, and imprison a parasite -- all in one gesture.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: But she's been exposed to the underside of life.  She is the underside of life.

turns.speaker: O'HARA
turns.text: And therefore an ideal prospect for rehabilitation.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: We're a small convent, Bishop.  Surely there are... more appropriate shelters.

turns.speaker: O'HARA
turns.text: Your small convent is in danger of closing, Reverend Mother.  The Las Vegas Police Department has offered to make a generous financial donation.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: But, Bishop...

turns.speaker: O'HARA
turns.text: St. Katherine's is a Benedictine Order. You have taken a Vow of Hospitality.  To all in need.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I lied.

turns.speaker: O'HARA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: But, Bishop, surely you realize -- this is a most dangerous neighborhood.

turns.speaker: O'HARA
turns.text: And you'll face that danger head-on.  As if I could stop you.  And you have my complete support in this matter. Anything you can do to revitalize this neighborhood would be a blessing.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: I mean, won't she talk? She seemed kind of upset.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: She did.  Bring her back.  Now.  For a talk.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Soon, you gorgeous thing... tell me... how lonely?

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: It's that call you were expecting, Vince.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Can you hold?  Can you try?

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: She's a nun, Vince.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: I love you, Chris.  I always will.  I gave you so much.  My time.  My affection.  A big-time career.  And how do you repay me?  What's the thanks I get?  Where's the loyalty, huh?  Where's the love?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: And who are you to talk?  You were nothing.  You couldn't even sing.  I must have been out of my mind.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: She's acting weird, Vince.  Ever since we picked her up.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: She's... she's a nun.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Are you nuts?  She's not a nun.  It's Christy.  She's a babe!

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: We both missed.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Okay, so the problem is still the nun outfit, right?

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Find 'em!

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: If we could speak alone.

turns.speaker: BALTUS
turns.text: This is not a time for frivolity, Katrina, is it?  Am I mistaken?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Excuse me, gentlemen, but... who has seen this Horseman?

turns.speaker: BALTUS
turns.text: Many have.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Then, name one person who has seen him with their own eyes.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Who took the meat?

turns.speaker: BALTUS
turns.text: Must have been the Redman.  A Lenape Indian lives in the Western Woods.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: These woods of yours sound a bit crowded, what with all the witches, ghouls and Indians living there.

turns.speaker: BALTUS
turns.text: Hail, Constable.  How are you?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Well enough.  Your gathering does honor to the deceased.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Um... I... I did not... no.  Why?

turns.speaker: BALTUS
turns.text: Sarah has gone missing... my servant girl.  Her things are gone.  Damn it. She has joined the migration out of town.  What about breakfast, woman?  Or, am I to starve to death?

turns.speaker: BALTUS
turns.text: Clergyman Steenwyck is calling a meeting.  This time he is determined to have you forced out, or worse.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: How did you hear this?

turns.speaker: BALTUS
turns.text: He came to me.  He promised great violence.  Said I should cast you out for my own protection.  I must speak honestly.  There is no reason to think he will not meet with success.

turns.speaker: BROM
turns.text: Certainly not.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Excuse me, Miss...  They have a laugh at your expense.

turns.speaker: BROM
turns.text: We haven't heard your name yet, friend.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Well, unless your name is Baltus, you should not worry over mine.

turns.speaker: BROM
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: You are the blacksmith.  Ever shod a horse with a hoof this large?

turns.speaker: BROM
turns.text: Never.  A shoe that size I would have remembered.

turns.speaker: BROM
turns.text: They spend two days in chains.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Two days... ?  For murder?

turns.speaker: BROM
turns.text: Constable Crane is not the only one who fights with science on his side.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I fired upon the Horseman and the bullet did nothing.

turns.speaker: BROM
turns.text: You must have missed your mark.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I hit him square.

turns.speaker: BROM
turns.text: I say... if the Horseman is solid enough to take the lives of our people, he's solid enough to feel this...

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: An honor, gentlemen.  In time I will need every detail of the three murderings you've had, but, for now, I ask only if you have any theory at all as to who the killer might be?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I say, is there any one person suspect in these acts?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: I was afraid of this.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Why did you move the body, Doctor?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: To place it inside its coffin.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: No bleeding.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: This should have bled by the pint. Yet, no blistering or scorched flesh. How... ?  Whatever weapon was used... it cauterized somehow....

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: We must be a curious sight to him.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: What are you spying on?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: The Lenape.  He comes to gawk at civilization from time to time.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: He is a behemoth.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: A diseased monster.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: The wounds are the same.  Cauterized. No chopping or half-measures either. One stroke took the head.  Have you seen, doctor... ?  Even the spinal bone... sliced as smooth as butter.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: I do not care.  You are welcome to use my work area, but I beg you... return her to her resting place.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: In time, doctor.  Soon as I finish.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: Keep still, Constable.  You were half-drowned when they found you.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: ... Brom Bones...

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: He is dead.  You would be also, if your wound had not somehow shut.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Bring Young Masbath here.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: You need to sleep.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Bring him.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: You need rest.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: It has been a terrible jolt to her nerves.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: You will stay at her side?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: ... help yourself, you pompous ass. I will be in bed.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Would you stay, doctor?  I may need assistance.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Stains of blood.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: What of it?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: No clotting or gathering of pus.  No healing at all.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR LANCASTER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: When this cut was made, this person was already dead.  This is not Lady Van Tassel.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: Why not tell us what you have heard? Hmm?  How much have your superiors bothered to tell you?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: All I know is three are slain, their heads found severed from their bodies...

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: The heads were not found severed. The heads were not found at all.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: It is sacrilege!

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I cannot proceed without examining the previous victims.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: I will not allow it.  I will not!

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Protest to my superiors if you like.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: Your superiors are two days away!

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Then, you should have left two days ago, because I have men willing to help me today.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: For poaching.  Or, would you remake our laws now that Magistrate Philipse has given up the ghost?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Does that look like an animal hanging?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Only if I repeat them outside this room.  And, I will if I must...  Out there, for all to hear.  Or... you may speak, as planned.  But, you tell them you feel compelled to move on to greener pastures.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: No.  You will not run me out.  No one will believe a word of what you say.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Oh?  Far as I can tell, a rumor does not travel alone for long here.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: Are you a deist?  Is that it?  A free thinker who does not believe in divinity.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: It is only important what you are. An adulterer...

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: I am the Lord's voice in this town.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Wallowing in sin and lust...

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: They need guidance.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Wallowing quite literally in blood.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: Damn you, sir!  God damn you to hell!

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: He may.  But, not soon enough for you, and not on your behalf.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: You are so upset now... and yet, you seemed in such good spirits last night.

turns.speaker: FATHER STEENWYCK
turns.text: You cannot do this.  I am a man of God!

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Climb to the top of the tallest ladder you can find, Father.  That is the closest you ever come to God.

turns.speaker: HARDENBROOK
turns.text: Taken.  Taken by the Headless Horseman.  Taken back to hell.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Pardon me?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Just a moment...  Are you saying it is he?

turns.speaker: HARDENBROOK
turns.text: When a goblin leaps from the nether world, others follow.  Poltergeists of the air, water and earth follow and cheer his desecrations!

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Do you have these persons' wills?

turns.speaker: HARDENBROOK
turns.text: I have everything... last testaments... birth certificates, death certificates... deeds.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Yes, sir... but, do you have these?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: May I see them, Master Hardenbrook?

turns.speaker: HARDENBROOK
turns.text: Hmm?  See them?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: May we look at them now?

turns.speaker: HARDENBROOK
turns.text: Of course.  You want them... it shall not take long.  Wait here.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Maybe you should take this.

turns.speaker: HARDENBROOK
turns.text: A fine idea.

turns.speaker: HARDENBROOK
turns.text: Damn... damn... damn...

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Master Hardenbrook...

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Perhaps, I could assist in finding them?

turns.speaker: HARDENBROOK
turns.text: Well... that might be... helpful.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Just a moment... if I may.  It is possible this man was murdered.

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: He drowned.  Anyone could see.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: There are surgical ways of telling how he died... by the water in his lungs...

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: He will be burned pursuant to statutes of health.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I could determine if he were dead <u>before</u> he went into the Hudson.

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: Must we again hear these heretical rantings?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Our first night watch is adequate against fire and some violence, but if we were more often able to ensure justice, after the fact, then criminals would truly have something to fear from law enforcement.

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: Have they nothing to fear presently?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Without disrespect, look around you.  We overflow.  As do our courts.

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: And, <u>with</u> disrespect, Constable, if jails and courts overflow, it is testimony to success, not failure.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: But, how many innocents rot here? And, how many victims are buried without reprisal while guilty men roam our streets?

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: Very few, if any.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Even though I have seen confessions pried from the lips of the accused, often quite literally?

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: For one who calls himself a Federalist, your mouth reeks of Republican liberalism.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Not Liberalism.  Equanimity.

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: There is a farming community upstate, Constable... ten days journey north in the Hudson Highlands.  It is named Sleepy Hollow.  Within a fortnight, three persons have been murdered there. Each with their head lopped cleanly off.  The elders of the Hollow have sent dispatches to me, requesting assistance, and now, just this very moment, I have chosen you.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Chosen me?

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: These "methods" of yours... there has been no practical application.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Not for lack of trying.

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: Just so.  Granted.  And so you take your experimentations to Sleepy Hollow and catch the murderer who has tainted the place.  Bring him here to face our good justice. Will you do this for me?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I shall, gladly.

turns.speaker: HIGH CONSTABLE
turns.text: Excellent.  Then, you are excused till morning.

turns.speaker: KILLIAN
turns.text: Master Crane, sir.  I'm glad we have time alone.  You've been told plenty about the Horseman, I'm certain.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: More than enough, actually.  I beg you, no more, please.

turns.speaker: KILLIAN
turns.text: No, sir, no.  If you ask me, I say you just laid eyes on our murderer through that glass.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Tell me something.  What becomes of Young Masbath?

turns.speaker: KILLIAN
turns.text: Van Ripper and his wife agreed to take him.  They have children and a good home and good land.

turns.speaker: KILLIAN
turns.text: The Widow Windsor.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Is that all you say?  Look at her.

turns.speaker: KILLIAN
turns.text: It's not something people speak of openly.  She did not remarry.

turns.speaker: PHILIPSE
turns.text: Well, Constable... are you aware... to be honest, you are not what we expected.  We sent for the militia.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: The militia?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: The Van Garretts died first; a man and his son, survived by a wife and two infants.  And the Widow Windsor was next...

turns.speaker: PHILIPSE
turns.text: And now Jonathan Masbath.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Why would he flee this direction, with so much open ground to cross before he reached cover?

turns.speaker: PHILIPSE
turns.text: He would not have gone into the Western Woods.  No sane man would.

turns.speaker: PHILIPSE
turns.text: ... found the body this morning.  You do believe now, don't you?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Believe?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: What is that you wear?

turns.speaker: PHILIPSE
turns.text: My talisman.  It will, protect against the Horseman if I show a brave face.  But, I cannot run.  If I run in fear, it is worthless.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Well... so much for common sense.

turns.speaker: PHILIPSE
turns.text: Not more than a year ago, a mob hung a man for stealing a horse.  For stealing a horse!  And, you dig up our dead.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Are you saying I should be frightened? Is this a message passed on from Clergyman Steenwyck?

turns.speaker: PHILIPSE
turns.text: We are farmers here, not lawyers or bankers, or even constables.  Every penny we earn comes from what we send down the Hudson.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I know it.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Listen to what you say....

turns.speaker: PHILIPSE
turns.text: No, you listen!  You may think we are a pack of superstitious dullards...

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: At times I do.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I am not here for revenge.  I am here to bring justice.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Whatever.  You still need a second to tend to your things.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I manage fine alone.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: I deserve to help you.  Don't you see how much this means?  My father... he... he was a good man...

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Young Masbath, I am sorry for your loss.  It is a great and sad tragedy. However... I cannot be the one to look after you now.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: I did not ask you to, did I?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: What is the common thread between these victims?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: I'm sure I don't know.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: We must discover it.  The reason the murderer chose these persons.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: The Lenape Indian had much to tell once I opened his mouth.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: How could he?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: His teeth.  Someone had cut them and chipped off rotten pieces far back in his mouth.  The Lenape could not have done that for himself.  Someone out there cared for him.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Up.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: It's payment day.  Loan monies are given to Baltus the last day each month.  Almost everyone borrows... for tools or to hire workers.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Out there.  What do you see?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: The Western Woods.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Look again.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Are you familiar with magnets?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: What kind of nuts?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Not for eating, I assure you.  Watch here.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: It's spectacular.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Yes... I suppose it is.  Keep it.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: No, I couldn't...

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I have others.  All I need is this.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Now, hold the bowl steady.  Back to business.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: If the Western Woods are truly the Devil's Glen, we will see for ourselves.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Father said witches live there.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Witches do not exist.  However...

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Listen.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: I hear nothing.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: No crickets or cicadas calling.  No bird songs.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: We are leaving.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Follow the Indian trail to where the sun dies.  To the tree of the dead.  Maybe we passed it by.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: How could something named "the tree of the dead" fail to draw attention?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: We should not go much further in this murk.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Should we go back?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: We are far from the Hollow.  Loath to say it... better to get our backs against a tree and stay till morning.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: What does it mean... climb down to the Horseman's soulless place?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: "Let loose his silent shrieking." Who knows, till we work at it?  I admit not being anxious to find out.  "He who holds the Horseman's desire will guide his reaping hand." Whatever the Horseman's desire is, other than extinguishing lives.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: If the Crone's wound bled hard, that means she was not killed by the Hessian.  Someone only tried to make it look that way.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: You grow sharper by the minute, little man.  It boggles my mind, but I begin to prefer your company over all others.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Well... I'm one of the few people who likes you.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: True enough.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Then, who murdered the Old Crone?  And why?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Good questions, deserving answers, of which we are in short supply.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Stay back.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Must be some sort of gateway.  But, why this place... ?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: We should go.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Why this tree?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: Someone left last night.  Looked like they headed to the square, but I lost them in the forest.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Man or woman?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: All I saw was their lantern.

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Business, best hidden is hidden best at night.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: If someone has the Horseman's skull... if they control the Horseman, then why haven't they sent him for your head yet?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: Because, I serve a fine purpose alive. It is perfection for our murderer if I return to New York City with nothing more than tales of a galloping ghoul.  We must uncover the reason these victims were targeted.  What was taken from them... other than their lives? Who benefits by their deaths?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MASBATH
turns.text: What good is this?

turns.speaker: ICHABOD
turns.text: To discover what might have been taken from those who died, it will help to know what was there that could be taken in the first place.
